meanings.definition: Free from anything of a different, inferior, or contaminating kind; free from extraneous matter
meanings.sent1: The water in the bottle was pure and clean.
meanings.sent2: She wore a pure white dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The pure joy on his face was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as pure as a crystal-clear stream.
meanings.sent5: The pure snow glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Containing nothing that does not properly belong; unadulterated
meanings.sent1: The cake was made with pure ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work was a pure expression of emotion.
meanings.sent3: His pure dedication to his craft was admirable.
meanings.sent4: The pure silence of the night was calming.
meanings.sent5: The pure joy of the children playing was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: Free from moral fault or guilt
meanings.sent1: Her intentions were pure and honest.
meanings.sent2: He had a pure heart and always helped others.
meanings.sent3: The pure kindness she showed was appreciated by all.
meanings.sent4: His pure conscience guided him to do the right thing.
meanings.sent5: The pure love between them was evident to everyone.

meanings.sent1: The pure joy of winning the game was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The pure beauty of the sunset took her breath away.
meanings.sent3: His pure determination to succeed was inspiring.
meanings.sent4: The pure silence of the desert was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The pure happiness in her smile was contagious.
